project.teaser: DigInTraCE aims at the development of i)transparent and interoperableDecentralised Traceability platform using novel tracking, sensing and sorting techniques ii)Dynamically updated DPPschemes supporting certification and quality validation iii)AI based and decision making...
project.objective: DigInTraCE aims at the development of i)transparent and interoperableDecentralised Traceability platform using novel tracking, sensing and sorting techniques ii)Dynamically updated DPPschemes supporting certification and quality validation iii)AI based and decision making mechanisms for process and lifecycle optimisation iv)up-cycling, reuse and upgrade technologies for improved secondary raw materials use v)contribute to standardization, open and easy accessible data vi)business models creating new economic opportunities and learning resources for employees, promoting new digital skills and meeting regional social needs. The solutions are demonstrated in the sectors of a) Pulp & Paper focused in 2 cases: composite wood and furniture; and wood and Pulp & Paper and b) Chemicals focused in 2 cases: plastic parts from ICT equipment and automotive market; and polymers and textiles: in 4 countries, while composite wood case combines both the 2 main sectors.
project.title: A Digital value chain Integration Traceability framework for process industries for Circularity and low Emissions by waste reduction and use of secondary raw materials
project.keywords: Circularity, Secondary raw materials, Waste, Traceability, Digitalisation, Digital Product Passport, Industry, Low Emissions

article.title: Innovative decentralised traceability platform for process industries

category.title: Project description

category.title: Computer sciences, information science and bioinformatics

result.title: Plastic parts and components analysis and origin for reuse optimisation v1
result.description: Identification of the chemical composition and classification of polymeric flakes is analysed, machine learning techniques controlling and optimizing processes and recipes are presented and integration of CLSC tool is evaluated. Related Task(s): T5.5

result.title: Digital Product Passport Concept v1
result.description: Document describes the required data captured and incorporated in DPPs in accordance with existing product information schemes and regulations, as well as a list of DPP features for the corresponding systems architecture. Related Task(s): T2.2

result.title: Sorting mechanisms for secondary streams valorisation v1
result.description: Document presents a set of requirements and associated technical specifications for sorting and describes the final sorting systems design and development for each value chain and demonstrator. Related Task(s): T3.2

result.title: Proteins recovery for wood-resin composite production v1
result.description: Extraction techniques, along with associated examined and optimised parameters for achieving maximum production yield will be presented, as well as analytical techniques for evaluation and drying method for obtaining final proteins described. Related Task(s): T5.2

result.title: Waste streams mapping
result.description: Initial assessment in terms of waste streams mapping per demonstrator is described, as an establishment of a baseline scenario focusing on potential hotspots related to production waste quality, cost, emissions, energy consumption and raw materials use. Related Task(s): T6.1

result.title: Novel Sensing technologies v1
result.description: Defines real-time monitoring requirements for each demonstrator and describes each systems final design, development, and validation procedure. Related Task(s): T3.1

result.title: Financial tool v1
result.description: Financial services toolkit designed after an initial review of available relevant marketplaces is described and related features in terms of market needs and pricing decision support on secondary and virgin materials are analyzed. Related Task(s): T4.3

result.title: Exploitation and Business Innovation Plan and activities v1
result.description: Initial (v1) version of the exploitation and business innovation plan and undertaken activities. Related Task(s):T7.3

result.title: Smart Tags v1
result.description: Deliverable exhibits Smart Tags use scenarios, presents tested real-time sensing and identification technologies and related results, approaches to support data integrity and integration, as well as stakeholders engagement strategies. Related Task(s): T3.3

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - DigInTraCE (A Digital value chain Integration Traceability framework for process industries for Circularity and low Emissions by waste reduction and use of secondary raw materials)
result.teaser: The DigInTraCE project aims to support the EU's sustainable and circular economy goals, in line with the European Green Deal, Circular Economy Action Plan (CEAP), and Digital Compass 2030. Despite policy frameworks promoting sustainable products and processes, challenges such...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Specifications definition and architecture of digital tracing v1
result.description: Presents produced technical specifications of the Decentralized Traceability platform architecture and the modules to be developed, including access rights, confidentiality issues and user roles. Related Task(s): T2.4

result.title: Wood by-products sorting and characterization for process optimisation v1
result.description: Deliverable involves characterization and classification requirements, in terms of by-products being directed towards specific valorization, and data analysis correlating secondary resource properties with the final products quality. Related Task(s): T5.3

result.title: MR enabler tool v1
result.description: Functionalities and characteristics of the MR enabled tool, e.g. type of data displayed, are presented, integration to the overall platform is described and demonstrated activities in the pilots are analyzed. Related Task(s): T4.4

result.title: Exploration and Mitigation of the Impact of Lighting Conditions on Multi-spectral Image Classification

details.authors: Sifnaios, S., Zorzos, I., Arvanitakis, G., Konstantinidis, F.K., Tsimiklis, G., & Amditis, A.J.
details.journalTitle: IEEE International Conference on Imaging Systems and Techniques (IST)

result.title: Fingerprints and markers for recycled material content v1
result.description: Fingerprints distinguishing recycled from virgin material, identified for either degraded molecules or additives, along with testing conditions is described to provide a commercially available recycled PET content methodology. Related Task(s): T5.4

result.title: Communication and Dissemination plan and activities v1
result.description: Initial (v1), of the dissemination and communication plan and undertaken activities. Related Task(s): T7.5

result.title: Secondary materials quality characterization for recycle,reuse upgrade
result.description: Document analyses secondary materials markets for the four different value chains and pinpoints the recycling/reuse and upcycling quality requirements of each potential valorization pathway. Related Task(s): T5.1

result.title: Methodology of Traceability v1
result.description: Document defines a complete strategy for discriminating the level of tracking & tracing materials and methods to acquire associated data, with special attention to digital representation of unit of product in compliance with blockchain technology. Related Task(s):T2.1

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
